I've been hearing opinions about the market's next move. If stagflation hits the US economy, is that good for option traders? Selling strangles or iron condors may be profitable. Are there strategies that work better in different economic environments? This is the season for predictions, but the real market will reveal the truth by February or March.

In trading, it is difficult to predict the market. Only time will reveal if we are in a period of stagflation. It is impossible to separate economic views from strategic trading and investing in real-time.
Trading and investing opportunities present themselves on a case-by-case basis, not on a macro picture.
